Core Interpretation Engine (Model-Agnostic)

Source: R/core_interpret.R
interpret_core.Rd

Generic interpretation engine that coordinates LLM-based analysis interpretation for any model type. Delegates model-specific logic to S3 methods.

Usage

interpret_core(
  model_data = NULL,
  fit_results = NULL,
  model_type = NULL,
  provider = NULL,
  model = NULL,
  chat_session = NULL,
  system_prompt = NULL,
  word_limit = 100,
  additional_info = NULL,
  output_format = "cli",
  heading_level = 1,
  suppress_heading = FALSE,
  max_line_length = 120,
  silent = 0,
  echo = "none",
  params = NULL,
  interpretation_args = NULL,
  llm_args = NULL,
  output_args = NULL,
  ...
)

Arguments

model_data

List. Model-specific data structure (loadings, parameters, etc.)

model_type

Character. Type of analysis ("fa", "gm", "irt", "cdm")

provider

Character. LLM provider (e.g., "anthropic", "openai", "ollama"). Required when chat_session is NULL (default = NULL)

model

Character or NULL. Model name

chat_session

Chat session object or NULL. If NULL, creates temporary session

system_prompt

Character or NULL. Optional custom system prompt to override the package default. If NULL, uses model-specific default system prompt. Ignored if chat_session is provided (default = NULL)

word_limit

Integer. Word limit for interpretations (default = 100)

additional_info

Character or NULL. Additional context for LLM

output_format

Character. Report format: "cli" or "markdown" (default = "cli")

heading_level

Integer. Markdown heading level (default = 1)

suppress_heading

Logical. Suppress report heading (default = FALSE)

max_line_length

Integer. Maximum line length for text wrapping (default = 120)

silent

Integer or logical. Controls output verbosity:

  • 0 or FALSE: Show report and all messages (default)

  • 1: Show messages only, suppress report

  • 2 or TRUE: Completely silent, suppress all output For backward compatibility, logical values are accepted and converted to integers.

echo

Character. Echo level: "none", "output", "all" (default = "none")

params

ellmer params object or NULL

...

Additional arguments passed to model-specific methods, including variable_info (data frame with 'variable' and 'description' columns, required for FA)

Value

Interpretation object with class c("{model_type}_interpretation", "interpretation", "list")

Details

This function orchestrates the interpretation workflow:

  1. Build system prompt (model-specific via S3)

  2. Initialize or use existing chat session

  3. Build user prompt (model-specific via S3)

  4. Send to LLM and get response

  5. Parse JSON response (generic with model-specific validation)

  6. Create diagnostics (model-specific via S3)

  7. Build report (model-specific via S3)

  8. Return interpretation object
